pr_title: fix(TypeScript): Ensure model validators are generated for fields of bean type

timeline.bodyText: This combination of annotations doesn't look right. I think @Nullable has to be removed.
timeline.author: knoobie

replies.author: platosha
knoobie

replies.bodyText:
@platosha Did I get the use case right that selection of MyForm (in the above example) is supposed to be a required field so that a null value is not considered valid (for submission), but it's "nullable" in the sense that we need to be able to store or refer to the state of the form when the user has not yet filled in the selection field?
So internally we need to be able to know that this field is null/empty even though it is a required field that must not be null for validation/submission.
replies.author: Haprog

replies.bodyText: I agree that combining annotations like @NotNull and @Nullable makes no sense at least if they would be visible in user projects. If we need an additional annotation, better naming would be required for it.
replies.author: Haprog
platosha
